result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas Anthony Leech

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicholas Anthony Leech appeared by video.  Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court for Nicholas Anthony Leech.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Michael Weiland, Milwaukee Police Department Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Nicholas Anthony Leech appeared by video.  Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke appeared by video for Nicholas Anthony Leech.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status of counsel.  Attorney Wineke recently appointed.  Court set a preliminary hearing date.  Court continues to toll time limits.  Court notes for the record that the defendant is compliant for JusticePoint. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Case adjourned to Branch 41.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Nicholas Anthony Leech appeared by video.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Preliminary Hearing.  State's witness appeared by zoom.  Court reviewed public defenders letter to the Court.  Court finds GOOD CAUSE to toll time limits for preliminary hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Received and Filed. Appointment Status Letter
Preliminary hearing on August 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nicholas Anthony Leech in court by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests that the matter be set for status; denied.   Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Br. 35. 
*Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nicholas Anthony Leech in court, in custody.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for indigency hearing. Court holds colloquy with the defendant. Defendant is not working at this time. Court orders SPD to re-evaluate the defendant. Case adjourned to Branch PE. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.

Court ordered no contact with KM, JMD, JAR, and any other minor children that reside with KM, due to the fact they were all witnesses to the
violence. 
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

ADDRESS INFO for Nicholas Anthony Leech
Current: 2514 S 8th St, Milwaukee, WI 53215   (Effective: 07-05-2022)
Prior: 722 North 53rd Street, #6, Milwaukee, WI 53208

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER for Electronic Monitoring. If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the Electronic Monitoring (GPS) waiting list. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Nicholas Anthony Leech in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Nicholas Anthony Leech in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nicholas Anthony Leech appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count(s) 2, 3, 5, and 6. Court advised defendant that due to nature of offense in Counts 1 and 4, a sample of your DNA is required.  If the sheriff's department hasn't already obtained a sample I order them to do so.  There are circumstances that you can request the sample to be expunged from the data base pursuant to statute 165.77(4).   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Indigency hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
